items.label: thm-cg-complete-gauge-group
items.title: Complete Gauge Group Emergence
items.content:
517: :label: thm-cg-complete-gauge-group
518: 
519: The Crystalline Gas algorithm ({prf:ref}`def-cg-dynamics`) naturally generates the gauge group:
520: 
521: $$
522: G_{\text{gauge}} = \text{SU}(3)_c \times \text{SU}(2)_L \times \text{U}(1)_Y
523: $$
524: 
525: with gauge fields constructed as follows:
526: 
527: | Gauge Group | Field Components | Algorithmic Origin | Degrees of Freedom |
528: |-------------|------------------|-------------------|-------------------|
529: | SU(3)_c | $A_{\mu}^a$, $a=1,\ldots,8$ | $(F \otimes p)_{\text{traceless}}$ | 8 gluons |
530: | SU(2)_L | $W_{\mu}^a$, $a=1,2,3$ | $S_{\text{ascent}} \cdot \hat{r}^a$ | W^±, Z (before mixing) |
531: | U(1)_Y | $A_{\mu}^{(Y)}$ | $\Phi(x)$ | Hypercharge boson B |
532: 
533: The complete gauge potential is:
534: 
535: $$
536: \mathcal{A}_{\mu} = \sum_{a=1}^{8} A_{\mu}^a \lambda^a + \sum_{a=1}^{3} W_{\mu}^a \tau^a + A_{\mu}^{(Y)} Y
537: $$

items.title: Gauge Covariance of Crystalline Gas Fields
items.content:
605: :label: thm-cg-gauge-covariance
606: 
607: The gauge fields constructed in {prf:ref}`thm-cg-complete-gauge-group` transform correctly under local gauge transformations:
608: 
609: **SU(3)_c:**
610: $$
611: \mathcal{A}_{\mu}^{\text{color}} \to U_3 \mathcal{A}_{\mu}^{\text{color}} U_3^{\dagger} + \frac{i}{g_s} U_3 (\partial_{\mu} U_3^{\dagger})
612: $$
613: 
614: **SU(2)_L:**
615: $$
616: \mathcal{W}_{\mu} \to U_2 \mathcal{W}_{\mu} U_2^{\dagger} + \frac{i}{g_2} U_2 (\partial_{\mu} U_2^{\dagger})
617: $$
618: 
619: **U(1)_Y:**
620: $$
621: A_{\mu}^{(Y)} \to A_{\mu}^{(Y)} + \frac{1}{g_1} \partial_{\mu} \alpha
622: $$

items.label: thm-cg-noether-current-vanishes
items.title: Noether Current Vanishes at QSD
items.content:
754: :label: thm-cg-noether-current-vanishes
755: 
756: The **Noether current** associated with the gauge symmetries, defined as:
757: 
758: $$
759: J_{\mu}(\mathcal{S}) := \sum_{i=1}^N v_i^{\mu} \otimes (T^a_{\text{color}} + T^a_{\text{weak}} + Y)
760: $$
761: 
762: has vanishing expectation value under the quasi-stationary distribution $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$:
763: 
764: $$
765: \mathbb{E}_{\pi_{\text{QSD}}}[J_{\mu}] = 0
766: $$

items.label: thm-cg-gauge-theory-emergence-main
items.title: Complete Gauge Theory Emergence (Main Result of Section 4)
items.content:
858: :label: thm-cg-gauge-theory-emergence-main
859: 
860: The Crystalline Gas algorithm ({prf:ref}`def-cg-dynamics`) with fitness landscape satisfying {prf:ref}`def-cg-fitness-landscape` naturally generates a pure SU(3)_c × SU(2)_L × U(1)_Y Yang-Mills theory at equilibrium through the following mappings:
861: 
862: | **Algorithmic Structure** | **Gauge Theory Interpretation** | **Mathematical Construction** |
863: |---------------------------|--------------------------------|-------------------------------|
864: | Force-momentum tensor $F \otimes p$ | 8 gluon fields (SU(3)_c) | $A_{\mu}^a = \partial_{\mu} \varphi^a$ where $(F \otimes p)_{\text{traceless}} = \sum_a \varphi^a \lambda^a$ |
865: | Companion direction $\hat{r}$ | 3 weak bosons (SU(2)_L) | $W_{\mu}^a = \partial_{\mu}(S_{\text{ascent}} \cdot \hat{r}^a)$ |
866: | Fitness value $\Phi(x)$ | Hypercharge boson (U(1)_Y) | $A_{\mu}^{(Y)} = \partial_{\mu} \Phi$ |
867: | Geometric ascent | Weak interactions | $S_{\text{ascent}} > 0$ for left-handed fermions |
868: | Local fitness optimum | Right-handed fermions | $S_{\text{ascent}} \leq 0$ decouples from SU(2)_L |
869: | Velocity $v_i$ | Matter current | $J_{\mu} = \sum_i v_i^{\mu} \otimes \text{charges}$ |
870: | QSD equilibrium | Pure gauge vacuum | $\langle J_{\mu} \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = 0$ |
871: 
872: The construction is:
873: - **Mathematically rigorous:** Every gauge field is explicitly defined from algorithmic quantities
